intro: Vernonanthura condensata, commonly known as the dense bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts upon maturity.
